channel.title: Model Selection on The Mouse Imaging Centre Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Model Selection on The Mouse Imaging Centre Blog

item.title: Bayesian Model Selection with PSIS-LOO
item.description: Pitch In this post I’d like to provide an overview of Pareto-Smoothed Importance Sampling (PSIS-LOO) and how it can be used for bayesian model selection. Everything I discuss regarding this technique can be found in more detail in Vehtari, Gelman, and Gabry (2016). To lead up to PSIS-LOO I will introduce Akaike’s Information Criterion (AIC) to lay the foundation for model selection in general, then cover the expected log predictive density, the corner stone of bayesian model selection.
